channel.title: Wondering
channel.description:
Am I able to make it so I can run my server from any computer in my house? Atm it's only from this computer I'm on atm..also I would like to know if my partner can run it also he has the files through dropbox...both windows. If there is a way please tell me how,Thank you.
Any more info needed post below.

item.title: Wondering
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

For running the server through dropbox on your other computers, yes its doable. Just load dropbox, login, download the files and run it. For your friend, make sure you have shared the folder (server) with your friend’s dropbox account.

Read full topic

item.title: Wondering
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

yeh you can use dropbox or a build in feature from windows if they are connected to the same internet, dropbox is probably better though.

you basically answered your own question

Read full topic

item.title: Wondering
item.dc:creator: @ProjectRezurrection ProjectRezurrection
item.description:
@ProjectRezurrection wrote:

It needs to be on the same network. :o Meaning if you friend is at home and he tries to run the server on his network using your no-ip it will not work. Because its your network your connecting to. Now if he is at your house using your network and its successfully portforwarded then yes its possible. but the drop box method will not work. Like if you would try to change something in the client.java and you saved everything and compiled nothing would not be changed if im not mistaken the computer your connecting to throught no-ip will have to compile . I maybe wrong about everything but idk im just trying to help.

Oh yea and yes your able to run anyserver from any computer in your house. as long as its portforwarded and you have no-ip etc.

Read full topic
